posts.post_content:
The flavor text fits this card perfectly. It would seem that Wizards is getting better with its assignment of flavor text as of late:  
  
Lightning Bolt form M10  
Sol Ring and this from Relics  
  
Just to name the ones off the top of my head. If they bring something back from the olden days of Lore, then it gets rather amazing flavor added to it.  
  
greg:  
  
Alas, you are correct. But it's still a great line.

Posted By: LarsBM (10/2/2010 3:12:31 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Leaning Ivory Tower of Piza. Nice.  
  
"If they bring something back from the olden days of Lore, then it gets rather amazing flavor added to it."  
  
Also: check out cards from the Ravnica block. Somewhere in there, Wizards hired the most talented flavor text writer ever to see existence in human society. This person seems to get random jobs here and there thereafter, but something like 40% or more of Ravnica cards have flavor text that makes you want to play the card no matter how mechanically unplayable it is.  
  
It's fantastic. Ravnica's the only set for which I set out to collect a complete set from scratch, just because each card added to the collection was a treasure in its own way -- usually because of wonderful flavor text, even when the art was so-so :)

Posted By: Salient (8/26/2011 7:18:48 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Great card for reliable lifegain early on.  
But if you can get to midgame, I'd use [Venser's Journal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Venser's Journal).  
  
Or hell, even both.  
  
I guess the best part about this card is how it hits the field early enough for you to still have the cards in your hand to power it.

Posted By: kiseki (8/9/2011 2:02:58 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Ivory Tower, [Howling Mine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Howling Mine) and [Library of Leng](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Library of Leng) were bestest friends back in the day. Now they've got even more new friends to play with, like [Reliquary Tower](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reliquary Tower), [Rhystic Study](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rhystic Study), [Consecrated Sphinx](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Consecrated Sphinx)....  
  
Once you have no limit on the number of cards in your hand, Ivory Tower can get out of control quickly. I've spent several games gaining 24+ life per turn off of a single Tower; at that point I didn't even bother to block. Of course in the current environment I'd need to do something to take care of Infect creatures, but that's not impossible by any stretch.  
  
Mildly related: [Gerrard's Wisdom](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gerrard's Wisdom). It's two Ivory Towers in Sorcery form.
posts.html:

Of course in the current environment I'd need to do something to take care of Infect creatures, but that's not impossible by any stretch.

Mildly related: Gerrard's Wisdom. It's two Ivory Towers in Sorcery form.
